messages.subject: Re: show and tell
messages.msgSnippet: At 09:37 AM 9/9/99 -0400, you wrote: I had wondered whether ... Oh I believe it is human nature.  That is why the ps use it - it works! All kids want to show
messages.messageBody:
At 09:37 AM 9/9/99 -0400, you wrote:
I had wondered whether
>this was something he picked up in school, but maybe it is just a function
>of being a person; I like to share my experiences with my friends too!
>
>
Oh I believe it is human nature. That is why the ps use it - it works!
All kids want to show off what they learn or something they really really
like. It interests them. :o)


In His Service,

Laraine
praxis@...

messages.subject: Re: show and tell
messages.msgSnippet: ... The show-and-tell-to-a-group part of school is one of the things my son really liked. I am afraid he is missing that aspect now with our very small family.
messages.messageBody:
At 11:51 PM 09/08/1999 -0400, you wrote:
>From: Hsmotgo@...
>Up until this year, they still want to do show and tell!
>That is their favorite thing to do, show off their toys. Oldest ds is
>getting over it, but even he likes to do it occasionally! Makes them feel
>good to just get up in front of everyone, (big crowed of 2! ) and talk about
>their favorite thing.



The show-and-tell-to-a-group part of school is one of the things my son
really liked. I am afraid he is missing that aspect now with our very small
family. He does like the days at our local HS group when the kids make
something and get together to share their creations. I had wondered whether
this was something he picked up in school, but maybe it is just a function
of being a person; I like to share my experiences with my friends too!

Olivia
